# krisyotam.com

> Personal website of Kris Yotam — a contemporary polymath exploring ideas
> across philosophy, mathematics, theology, literature, and technology.
> The site contains essays, academic papers, creative writing, notes, reviews,
> and various intellectual explorations.

## Site Overview

- **Author**: Kris Yotam
- **Domain**: krisyotam.com
- **Type**: Personal website / Digital garden / Knowledge base
- **Language**: English (primary)
- **Established**: 2024
- **Tech Stack**: Next.js 14, React, TypeScript, MDX
- **Content License**: Various (see /legal for specifics)

## Content Philosophy

This site follows the digital garden philosophy: content exists in various
states of completion, from rough notes to polished essays. Each piece of
content includes metadata indicating its maturity:

- **Status**: Draft, Notes, In Progress, Finished, Abandoned
- **Confidence**: How certain the author is (impossible → certain)
- **Importance**: 1-10 scale of significance to the author's work

## Content Metadata Schema

All content pieces include standardized metadata:

```
title: string           # The title of the piece
subtitle?: string       # Optional subtitle
preview: string         # Brief description (for search/cards)
start_date: string      # When writing began (YYYY-MM-DD)
end_date?: string       # When finished (YYYY-MM-DD)
status: enum            # Draft | Notes | In Progress | Finished | Abandoned
confidence: enum        # impossible | remote | highly unlikely | unlikely |
                        # possible | likely | highly likely | certain
importance: number      # 1-10 scale
tags: string[]          # Topic tags
category: string        # Primary category
state?: string          # active | hidden
```

## Raw Markdown Access (IMPORTANT FOR LLMs)

**To fetch raw markdown/MDX source, append `.md` or `.mdx` to any content URL.**

This is the preferred method for LLMs to fetch content, as it provides clean
markdown without HTML rendering, navigation, or styling.

### Examples

| Rendered Page | Raw Markdown |
|---------------|--------------|
| /blog/intelligence/remarks-on-measured-intelligence | /blog/intelligence/remarks-on-measured-intelligence.md |
| /essays/musings/boy-interrupted | /essays/musings/boy-interrupted.md |
| /papers/philosophy/on-free-will | /papers/philosophy/on-free-will.md |
| /notes/philosophy/stoic-ethics | /notes/philosophy/stoic-ethics.md |

### Supported Content Types

Raw markdown is available for these routes:
- /essays/[category]/[slug].md
- /blog/[category]/[slug].md
- /fiction/[category]/[slug].md
- /news/[category]/[slug].md
- /notes/[category]/[slug].md
- /ocs/[category]/[slug].md
- /papers/[category]/[slug].md
- /progymnasmata/[category]/[slug].md
- /reviews/[category]/[slug].md
- /verse/[type]/[slug].md

### Vanity URLs

Some pages have short vanity URLs that also support `.md`:

| Vanity URL | Raw Markdown | Actual Content |
|------------|--------------|----------------|
| /me | /me.md | About Kris Yotam |
| /about | /about.md | About This Website |
| /faq | /faq.md | Frequently Asked Questions |
| /logo | /logo.md | About My Logo |
| /design | /design.md | Design of This Website |
| /donate | /donate.md | Support/Donate Page |

### Response Format

Raw markdown requests return:
- **Content-Type**: text/markdown; charset=utf-8
- **Body**: Pure MDX/Markdown source with frontmatter

Example response:
```markdown
---
title: "Article Title"
subtitle: "Optional Subtitle"
start_date: "2025-01-01"
status: "Finished"
confidence: "likely"
importance: 7
tags: ["philosophy", "ethics"]
category: "musings"
---

# Article Title

Content begins here...
```
